title: Jochem H. Smit
text: My interest in mechanisms of physical law and biological machinery is what drives me to do research. I have a strong background in both Chemistry and Physics as well as programming expertise which allows me to contribute to a broad range of interdisciplinary research projects. In our lab we use a combination of HDX-MS and smFRET to study protein (non)folding and chaperone interactions.

title: Software
text:
InstaGibbs





The aim of instagibbs is to rapidly and easily obtain Linderstrøm-Lang ΔG and ΔΔG values from HDX-MS data both at the peptide and residue level. The web interface pulls published HDX-MS datasets from a database and can be accessed and visualized directly as peptide, residue and protein structure representations.





Apr 23, 2025












Don’t FRET





Don’t FRET! is a python package featuring a web application for performing burst search and downstream analysis on confocal smFRET data.





Apr 9, 2024












ipymolstar





ipymolstar wraps the Mol* molecular visualization library for use in Jupyter notebooks or python-based web aplications. 





May 10, 2024












PyHDX





PyHDX is used to analyize HDX-MS datasets and express them as residue-level Gibbs free energies. Deuterium uptake kinetics are described as a single fit parameter per-residue using a PyTorch optimizer and the Linderstrøm-Lang model of Hydrogen-Deuterium Exchange. The project features an interactive web interface where users can upload, analyze and visualize their data.





Jan 11, 2024












HDXrate





HDX intrinsic exchange rate calculation of amide hydrogens.





Oct 23, 2023












ColiCoords





ColiCoords is a python project for analysis of fluorescence microscopy data from rodlike cells. The project is aimed to be an open, well documented platform where users can easily share data through compact hdf5 files and analysis pipelines in the form of Jupyter notebooks.

title: Solarafold
text:
Solarafold is a solara based viewer for alphafold3 modelling results. Users can upload their alphafold3 .zip result file and view resulting models with ipymolstar.
For full screen and source code head over to the HuggingFace space.
